snippet: There seemed to be a step forward on oxygen flow problems last month, but then a pilot told of discomfort from intermittent airflow into his mask during flight.
abstract: Air Force claims that it has made significant progress in fixing oxygen flow problems on the F-22 Raptor fighter jet, but a pilot has complained about discomfort from intermittent airflow into his mask during a recent flight.
lead_paragraph: There seemed to be a step forward on oxygen flow problems last month, but then a pilot told of discomfort from intermittent airflow into his mask during flight.

headline.seo: For F-22, Oxygen Problems Elude Air Force’s Fixes
headline.main: Oxygen Problems on F-22 Elude the Air Force’s Fixes
headline.print_headline: Oxygen Problems on F-22 Elude the Air Force’s Fixes
